intro: Hiraea houlletiana, commonly known as the Houllet's hiraea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often found growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
